channel.title: GUI's

item.title: GUI's
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:2, topic:422949”]try a vector
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/Vector.html[/quote]
A vector is relatively slow compared with other generics. You should avoid it. It’s now a legacy class.

Read full topic

item.title: GUI's
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Thanks, but one problem; prob a small.
I got this now, but how would I add a specific object to the array?

[code=java]
/**
*
* ItemStrings holds the item strings.
* PriceStrings holds the prices.
* @param Items to add to the array.
* @param Prices to add to the array.
*
* i want it so what i add goes into these arrays so it will display it.
*/
public static void AddToList(String Items, int Prices) {
Vector<int[]> prices = new Vector<int[]>();
int index = 0;
prices.add(index, Pricestrings);
index++;

	Vector<String[]> items = new Vector<String[]>();
	items.add(0, ItemStrings);
	new Info().setVisible(true);
}[/code]

item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I’m working on GUI’s, trying to learn other things than just server-sided shit. This is a basic one I came up with, but i’m having some problems.

Here are the classes.

Loots.class

[code=java]import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

/*

      private void jButton1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
      try {
      BufferedWriter items = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“C:/Java/itemsPked.txt”, true));
      try {
      items.newLine();
      items.write("Pked: “+ItemsPked.getText());
      items.write(”\tPrice: "+Integer.parseInt(PriceInAll.getText()));
      JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,“Saved your items, thanks.”);
      } finally {
      items.close();
      }
      } catch (IOException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
      }
      System.out.println(“Adding to array now…”);
      Info.AddToList(ItemsPked.getText(), Integer.parseInt(PriceInAll.getText()));
      }

    /**

Info.class


import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;

/*

/*

/**

@SuppressWarnings("serial")
public class Info extends javax.swing.JFrame {

    /** Creates new form Info */

            }

        jList2.setModel(new javax.swing.AbstractListModel() {

        });
        jScrollPane2.setViewportView(jList2);

    /*
     * Item String array.
     */
    static String[] ItemStrings = {  };
    
    /*
     * Price string array.
     */
   	static int[] Pricestrings = {  };
   	
    /**
     * 
     * ItemStrings holds the item strings.
     * PriceStrings holds the prices.
     * @param Items to add to the array.
     * @param Prices to add to the array.
     */
    public static void AddToList(String Items, int Prices) {
    	for(int j = 0; j < ItemStrings.length; j++) {
    			ItemStrings[j] = Items;
    			System.out.println(Items);
    			System.out.println(ItemStrings[j]);
    	}
    	System.out.println(Items);
    	new Info().setVisible(true);
    }

	}

I want it so when I enter strings/integers into the loots GUI that it adds it to the arrays/list in the next GUI(info.java).

Read full topic
